lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* Represents the entire chatbot. Central class that initialises all chatbot variables and runs the chatbot
* @param filePath file on hard disk that tasks are saved
* Initialises necessary variables for chatbot and runs the chatbot
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
* Error to be thrown if command is given without the necessary arguments
super("☹ OOPS!!! The description of a " + message + " cannot be empty.");
* Parses in the user input and executes the corresponding actions
* Parses the command and matches it with the corresponding action to be taken
* Executes the action on the task list given
* @param tasks ArrayList of current tasks stored on the chatbot
* @return boolean true if bye command entered and chatbot should be stopped, false otherwise
* Loads the task list from a file in the hard disk and updates any changes in the
* task list in the same file
* Loads list of tasks previously saved in hard disk
* If no previous file exists, create a new file
* @return ArrayList of tasks that were loaded from hard disk
* Saves tasks to hard disk; updates any previous file with new task list
* @param tasks TaskList used to update the file and save new tasks onto hard disk
public void saveTasks(TaskList tasks) throws IOException {
* Stores lists of tasks and performs actions on them
* Adds a task to the task list
* Deletes a task from the task list
* @param index index of task to be deleted from current task list
* Returns list of all current tasks
* Prints list of all current tasks
* Marks a specified task on the task list
* @param index index of task to be marked
* Unmarks a specified task on the task list
* @param index index of task to be unmarked
* Prints a specified task on the task list
* @param index index of task to be printed
* Gets current number of tasks on the task list
* @return current number of tasks on task list
* Finds all tasks in the current task list that has a description containing keyword
* @param keyword keyword that should be searched for in tasks
* @return TaskList task list of tasks that contain the keyword
* Class to handle all inputs and outputs for user interaction
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Prints the corresponding output to user according to the command given
* @param index index of task that command should be carried out on (0 if not applicable)
public void printCorrectMessage(Commands command, TaskList taskList, int index) {
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + taskList.getSize() + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* @param errorMessage datetime if DateTimeParseException thrown, error message itself otherwise
System.out.println("We do not recognise this date time format! Please enter in yyyy-mm-dd format!");
* Error to be thrown if a command that is not recognised is given
super("☹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Represents deadlines in the task list, storing the description of the deadline and the deadline itself as string
* Returns properly formatted string to be displayed to user
* @return String formatted for user to read
* Represents events in the task list, storing the description of the event and the time of event as string
* Returns properly formatted string to be displayed to user
* @return String formatted for user to read
* Used to represent any type of tasks, to do, deadline, or events and their relevant information
* Unmarks a task; marks a task as undone
* Get string representation of whether task is marked
* @return "X" if task is marked, " " if task is not marked
* @return description the description of the task
* Get corresponding letter tag for each type of task
* @return "T" if to do, "E" if event, "D" if deadline
* Get deadline from deadlines and event timings from events
* @return string representing deadline for deadlines, event timings for events, "" for to do
* Represents to do items on task list and stores their description
Deadline Party = new Deadline("Birthday Party", date);
Deadline Party = new Deadline("Birthday Party", date);
Event Party = new Event("Birthday Party", date);
Event Party = new Event("Birthday Party", date);
assertEquals(new Todo("Read a book").toString(), "[T][ ] Read a book");
Todo readBook = new Todo("Read a book");
Todo readBook = new Todo("Read a book");
